newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Montenegro port in deals with Sealand, Hapag Lloyd.
newsitem.headline: Montenegro port in deals with Sealand, Hapag Lloyd.

text.p: Montenegro's Adriatic port Luka Bar has signed two deals with foreign shipping companies this week opening new international container lines, the Bar port said in a statement faxed to Reuters on Friday.
The first deal was signed with the U.S. company Sealand and the second with Germany's Hapag Lloyd, which rank among the top container transporters in the world, the statement said.
Both companies will regularly, once in every fifteen days, dock in the port of Bar with container services planned to start at the end of July.

Cooperation with Sealand is of particular importance for the Montenegrin port because it will link Luka Bar and its business partners with a network of nearly 100 ports to which the U.S. company sails, Luka Bar said.
Sealand's agent for Yugoslavia is Moko-marketing company of Belgrade while Hapag Lloyd will be represented by Jugexpress, also of Belgrade. -- Amra Kevic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 311 4305
